  physical_appearance: The image depicts a box with a top cover. The top cover is slightly slanted
 revealing the interior of the box and its contents. A line of circular cards can be discerned inside. The sides of the exterior of the box are painted with different colours in horizontal lines
 along with motifs of scrolls. The top cover is depicts an image of a male figure with long hair and a beard. The figure is standing on one leg
 with the other folded across his knees. His right hand is shown to be holding a shiny circular object.

  subject_terms_1: recreation card games (game sets) entertaining cultural diffusion scrolls (motifs) figures (representations)

  subject_terms_3: Games

  sgcool_label_text: Ganjifa is pan-Indian
 played in its various forms in Indian regions including Maharashtra
 Rajasthan
 Bengal
 Orissa
 Karnataka
 among others. The ganjifa game of cards originated in Persia but it really flourished in India where the game developed in various forms. Meanwhile
 in Persia
 the game largely died out. Initially in India
 the game was played by the Mughals of northern India
 but it soon spread to most parts of the country. The proposed set underscore a rare aspect of Indian heritage – a craft tradition akin to miniature painting and a lesser known Indian game.

metadata.title_text: Ganpa or Ganjifa Cards in a box A Set of Ganpa or Ganjifa Cards
metadata.physical_appearance: The image depicts a box with a top cover. The top cover is slightly slanted, revealing the interior of the box and its contents. A line of circular cards can be discerned inside. The sides of the exterior of the box are painted with different colours in horizontal lines, along with motifs of scrolls. The top cover is depicts an image of a male figure with long hair and a beard. The figure is standing on one leg, with the other folded across his knees. His right hand is shown to be holding a shiny circular object.
metadata.subject_terms_1: recreation card games (game sets) entertaining cultural diffusion scrolls (motifs) figures (representations)
metadata.subject_terms_2: Motifs Boxes Culture diffusion Card games Playing cards Amusements
metadata.sgcool_label_text: Ganjifa is pan-Indian, played in its various forms in Indian regions including Maharashtra, Rajasthan, Bengal, Orissa, Karnataka, among others. The ganjifa game of cards originated in Persia but it really flourished in India where the game developed in various forms. Meanwhile, in Persia, the game largely died out. Initially in India, the game was played by the Mughals of northern India, but it soon spread to most parts of the country. The proposed set underscore a rare aspect of Indian heritage – a craft tradition akin to miniature painting and a lesser known Indian game.
